fields.description:
I want to suggest strike-through behaviour to be explained in JIRA documentation and also in Greenhopper documentation. You might want to consider it to be explained in:

* [Linking Issues|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues]
* [Configuring your Task Board Settings|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring%20your%20Task%20Board%20Settings]


This is needed as customer will get confused on the strike-through behaviour.


Regards,
Janet
fields.summary: Strike through behaviour to be explain in the documentation

fields.description:
We make extensive use of email notifications. One of the requirements we have is that when issues are linked, affected users must all be notified. However, linking is an operation, and not a workflow transition, therefore we cannot use custom events to notify us of this.

Therefore, we have urgent need of system events for this operation, as well as other operations that do not have events associated with them.
fields.summary: We need system events for when issues are linked so that we can trigger a notification email

fields.description:
When working with issues with long lines in IE7, the horizontal scrolling does not work. When creating or editing an issue, this leaves the user stuck in preview mode, unable to switch back to wiki markup mode or save the issue. When viewing an issue, this prevents the user from seeing any content to the right of the first screenful.

Creating an issue:
1) If Wiki rendering is not enabled, enable it by selecting Administration->Field Configurations->Default Field Configuration->Description->Renderers->Wiki Style Renderer.
2) Create a new issue and set the summary.
3) In the issue description, add a "noformat" block with a single long line of text.
4) Click the preview button to the right of the description field.

At this point, the page expands horizontally to show the content on one line. However, in IE7, a horizontal scroll bar is not created. This causes a few problems:
* The user can't see the content of the description field.
* The user can't see the preview button to return to wiki markup mode to edit the description further.
* If the line is long enough, the user can't see the Create button to create the issue.

There is a workaround - to tab through the fields - but it is non-obvious.
5) Press <tab> until the "Create" button is selected, and click it to go to the issue's view page.

At this point, the page has been horizontally expanded to fit the whole content, and a horizontal scrollbar is present. However, on IE7, if you scroll horizontally, there is only whitespace to the right of the first screenful.

Does not reproduce in IE6, IE8 or FireFox.
fields.summary: Horizontal scrolling does not work when viewing, creating or editing issues in IE7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19879].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce (tested on j.a.c):

   1. Bring up any list of issues in the Issue Navigator.
   2. Save the list as a filter named "Test for Me"
   3. Add a new Gadget of type "Issue Statistics" to your dashboard
   4. Type "Test for Me" in the "Project or Saved Filter:" box to do the quick find.
   5. The filter does not appear in the list of filters

Typing "Test for" also does not work. It will search for the two character("Test","for") separately.
fields.summary: Issue statistics Gadget AJAX quick find in Project or Saved Filter field doesn't work properly

fields.description:
The "subtasks" view in a parent task is handy b/c it summarizes the list of subtasks, their status, and remaining time to completion.  The undesired limitations are that the subtasks must be in the same project, and they must be of a subtask type.

We typically have issues in one project (a customization project) that depend on issues in another project (a platform or library project).  Ideally we want to "file" the issue in the correct project, but have been resorting to cloning the issue in both projects and manually updating both.  It would be swell if we could obtain a similar view to the subtasks view, but using issues from other projects.

Two implementation ideas are enabling a panel summarizing status and time remaining for the issues linked via outgoing links; or a new type of issue field that can contain issues from other projects, and which displays the summary of the other issues.
fields.summary: Enable detailed view of linked issues - or a "issue container" issue field
Show filter owner username in filter UI

fields.description:
Say I have a parent issue PR-10, then when I create sub-tasks under this, the system should create PR-10.1, PR-10.2 etc.

The current system generate a new issue id, How do I configure to generate a new numbering scheme?
fields.summary: Sub-Task number generation customization or configuration

fields.description:
When using the issue navigator, you can add columns for "Sub-Tasks" and "Issue Links".   These columns display issue IDs of subtasks and linked issues.   As expected, these issue keys are hyperlinked to the corresponding issue, so clicking on the key takes you to the subtask or linked issue.

When the issue navigator data is exported to Excel (either current fields or all fields), the issue keys for Sub-Tasks and Issue Links are not hyperlinked like they are in the issue navigator.   According to a comment on JRA-14800, these items should be hyperlinked in the Excel view.
fields.summary: Subtasks and Issue Links are not hyperlinked when exported to Excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19874].
  {panel}

With the current mail handler, if Jira receives an email whose address is associated with a user that does not have permission to comment or create issues, the email is rejected. However, if the address is not associated with any user, and the handler has a reporterusername, then the comment will be added as that default user.

This ends in the absurd situation where a non existing user can add comments to a case, but an existing user cannot. This user could then create a bogus email account to add comments to the issue.

In my understanding, the logic of the handleMessage/getReporter mail handlers should be changed. For the previous case (existing user but no permissions) the logic should be:

# Get user from email
# If user exists, check if user has permission to perform operation
# If no permissions, fall back to reporterusername

I am aware that [JRA-16786] was raised in the past with a similar request, and the functionality was claimed to be like that by design. However, I think the situation I describe is a flaw in that design.

If the logic was as described before, we could have avoided creating the proxy commenter for SAC to fix [JRA-15431]. The proxy commenter performs the logic as described before (with some additional magic)
fields.summary: CreateOrCommentHandler should fall back to defaultreporter if email user does not have permissions to perform operation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19873].
  {panel}

One of our projects now has over 32000 issues that each have attachments.
When a user went to give the 32,001 issue an attachment, the file system refused it because it has a maximum of 32000 file handles per directory.  
The problem is that each issue gets its own sub-directory underneath the project key in the attachment path.  
There needs to be some sort of arbitrary middle directory between the project key and the issue directory, similar to how photos are stored on SIM cards. Maybe group issues in groups by the fourth power of ten?  

For example, instead of 

/usr/local/jira/attachments/JRA/JRA-123456

have

/usr/local/jira/attachments/JRA/120000/JRA-123456

For now we've moved the 1,000 oldest attachments to another directory, effectively deleting them from the Jira web site.  
So we have a couple weeks to come up with some patch for this or we keep effectively archiving or deleting old attachments.

I understand from our OS folks that it would be possible to recompile the kernel to have a higher maximum file handle setting.  However, my management wants to pursue an application solution rather than risk the OS recompilation solution.

fields.description:
When attaching an image to an issue as part of an issue comment, the image is properly displayed in-line in the Activity Stream view for that issue.  However if I attach an image via the Create Issue screen when first creating an issue, that image will not be displayed in the Activity Stream.  I would expect attaching an image to always behave the same with respect to Activity Streams.

See the activity stream on this issue for an example.
fields.summary: Image attachments added at issue creation time are not displayed in the Issue Activity Stream

fields.description:
In some cases it would be very handy if a sub-task could be assigned to another Jira project than the parent issue type.

example: parent issue is a product requirement for a given product (=Jira project). the requirement is relevant for other products as well - or other products have to do work for this requirement. It would be helpful if these dependencies could be modelled via sub-tasks. if all sub-tasks are done then the parent issue is done as well.
fields.summary: Allow sub-tasks to be assigned to OTHER project

fields.description:
Hi,

See relevant previous references from jira.atlassian.com:
- JRA-12845
- JRA-16399
- ** JRA-14910 **

See previous internal support request - most detail on our issue is captured here: 
- JSP-47280

For the purposes of this request please note that my setup is almost identical to that described in JRA-14910. 
We are using a apache proxy server which is listening on ssl(https) and proxying requests to the Jira tomcat instance on http. Thus, since the printable page is accessed on a fully qualified url with a base url on http it fails to display. 

All other issues open on this area have been closed with statements that either using:
1) ProxyPreserveHost will fix it
2) Implement SSL on the Jira Tomcat instance will resolve it. 

In our case as in JRA-14910 the ProxyPreserveHost setting does not fix the issue as we are proxying https requests on as http. And I don't accept that we should have to implemtent SSL listening on the Tomcat instance.
We have a number of internal and 3rd party developed applications running in our environment and Jira is the only one that has an issue with https proxying back thru apache to http in this manner. 

What I have not been able to ascertain in either my internal support request or in reviewing other issues on jira.atlassian.com is _why_ the printable page link is implemented with a absolute url yet all other links are relative?

Thanks & Regards ... Gareth
fields.summary: Printable page uses absolute base URL not relative base URL

fields.description:
When editing the settings for the "Time to First Response" gadget, the headings in the preview frame are corrupted in IE7.

1) Add a new page.
2) Insert Macro->Time to First Response.
3) Set the project to "A Test Project".
4) Click Save.
5) Click Edit.

The headings in the preview frame appear incorrectly - all three headings are displayed in the same place.
fields.summary: Dialogue headings are corrupted when editing gadget settings in IE

fields.description:
It appears that JIRA does not kill all the indexing threads when running the func tests. I guess it has something to do with the rate that we import data.

In the middle of the windows installer func tests there were over 1600 indexing threads active but not doing anything. I have attached the stack trace.
fields.summary: Indexing threads do not seem to shutdown correctly when running JIRA func tests.

fields.description:
Please add {{/rest}} to the list of default URLs that appear on the "Add New Trusted Application" screen -- "URL Paths to Allow".

People will need the trusted app to include the {{/rest}} URL so that they can add gadgets to JIRA and use trusted apps instead of OAuth.
fields.summary: Add "/rest" to default URLs on screen for adding a new trusted application

fields.description:
If you make a GET request such as

http://jira.atlassian.com/rest/gadget/1.0/pickers/projectsAndFilters?fieldName=quickfind&query=%20

Tomcat will actually serve up the parameters as
fieldName="quickfind"
query="" (EMPTYSTRING).

This means any attempt to use query parameters which consist only of space characters (such as typing just the space key in the project picker) will have an invalid OAuth signature as it is expected to have a value of %20.
This then causes the token to be revoked (joy!) and pretty much prevents the gadget from working after that.

Possibly the fix for this should be in our OAuth infrastructure, but it would appear the REST api is going to need to have a way to deal with this situation anyway so I have created this issue against JIRA.
fields.summary: WordCurlyQuotesRequestWrapper breaks OAuth signing process

fields.description:
As stated in the title, the linked status of every step in draft workflow cannot be edited. If you make a copy of an 'Active' state workflow, you will be able to edit the linked status. I believe that both creating a copy of a workflow and making a draft workflow should have the same ability in editing the linked status of a step.

Here is the step on how to reproduce this error:
# Create a workflow and activate it by associating with a workflow scheme and then to a project.
# Create draft for the 'Active' state workflow
# Click on the +Steps+ under the newly created draft workflow
# Click on any Step Name
# Then, click on +Edit+ step

You should be able to see that the Linked Status to the Step Name is *uneditable* (blurred out). 
In addition to that, underneath the Linked Status option, you will be seeing the following description:
{noformat}
Cannot change the linked status of an existing workflow step. 
{noformat}

This is reproducible in JIRA 3.13.x and also in JIRA 4.0.
fields.summary: Linked Status is not editable in Draft Workflow when it is supposed to be editable

h3. Background:
+Created vs. Resolved Issues Report+ is great but unfortunately tells only one side of the story. Let's assume that process is something like this:
# A reporter creates a new issue
# A developer resolves the issue
# A tester closes the issue or reopens it

Now, there are a few interesting figures to follow:
* created vs. resolved (in the box already), tells how developers can manage their workload
* resolved vs. closed, tells how testers can handle their workload
* resolved vs. reopen, tells something about the quality of development

----
h3. Suggestion:
Enhance the current +Created vs. Resolved Issues Report+ so that a user can select freely what statuses to compare. Consider also adding several statuses together (e.g. created + reopened vs. resolved + closed). It is alright to have a single chart for each of the compared pairs but it would be even better to configure a single chart to show several pairs.
fields.summary: Enhance Created vs. Resolved Issues Report

fields.description:
When a user selects "Create Issue" it is extremely desirable to have no default selected in the Project filed. This is due to the fact that many users simply click Next without realizing that they must select the correct Project in which to create the new issue. 

It would be preferable to have a global system option (e.g. "Force Project Selection") that, when enabled, would add an item such as "<Please select a project>" to be displayed in the Project field for the initial step of "Create Issue". Furthermore, if a user did not select a Project in this step, but simply clicked Next, a warning message would be displayed that indicates a Project must be first selected.

An example Warning message could be:
<red>"You must specify the JIRA Project in which to create this issue."</red>

It would be even better if the warning message was configurable by the JIRA Administrator.

Please refer to the discussion in the following issue for relevant information:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8530
fields.summary: Add option to FORCE user to select a Project when creating an issue

fields.description:
Hi,
I'm managing a rather large JIRA instance, that evolved over time. For quite a time, there was no concept, when people should be put in groups and these groups assigned to project roles, or when people should be added to project roles directly. 
This leads to somehow cumbersome administration sometimes, as it's not always clear, when to use a group, and what exactly happens, when a user is added to a group.

Our main problem there is, that it's currently not easy (without a huge amount of manual work) to find out, where a group is used. Or to be more exact, it's not easy to find out to which project roles (in which projects) a group is assigned to.

Does this feature already exist, and I'm only missing it?

Thanks for your support & Cheers

Benjamin
fields.summary: Possibility to find out, in which projects/roles a group is used

Jira should either not allow staff to be added as watchers who have no rights to watch or (less ideally) should send notifications to the staff but the contents of the notification should say something like "You have received this notification because you are watching issue FOO-1 but you have to rights to view this issue. fields.description:
Modern operating systems have been improving the efficiency of system startup and system shutdown. One leading edge example of this is Fedora. The JIRA shut down script:

.../bin/shutdown.sh

Or:

.../bin/catalina.sh stop

Will take some time to complete, but even after it exits successfully, the JIRA process is still running for several seconds after:

{code}
[jira@wcarh034]~% bin/jira-service stop
Detecting JVM PermGen support...
^PPermGen switch is supported. Setting to 256m

jira      3472     1  0 Nov21 ?        00:06:55 /usr/java/jdk/bin/java -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/evolution/tools/jira/current/conf/logging.properties -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Xms128m -Xmx256m -Xms512m -Xmx768m -XX:+UseParallelOldGC -XX:ParallelGCThreads=2 -XX:+UseBiasedLocking -XX:-UsePerfData -Djava.awt.headless=true -Datlassian.standalone=JIRA -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true -Dmail.mime.decodeparameters=true -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/evolution/tools/jira/current/common/endorsed -classpath /evolution/tools/jira/current/bin/bootstrap.jar -Dcatalina.base=/evolution/tools/jira/current -Dcatalina.home=/evolution/tools/jira/current -Djava.io.tmpdir=/evolution/tools/jira/current/temp org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap start
postgres  3485  2151  0 Nov21 ?        00:00:32 postgres: jira jira 127.0.0.1(53473) idle                     
postgres  3562  2151  0 Nov21 ?        00:00:30 postgres: jira jira 127.0.0.1(50060) idle                     
postgres  3617  2151  0 Nov21 ?        00:00:00 postgres: jira jira 127.0.0.1(50160) idle

jira      8829  8828  0 10:26 pts/0    00:00:00 -zsh
jira      8908  8829  0 10:27 pts/0    00:00:00 ps -ef
{code}

If the operating system completes the shutdown scripts and enters the kill process phase before JIRA has shut down, it seems that lock files for $CATALINA_PID and/or JIRA home can be left around leading to every manual reboot becoming an unclean shutdown case.

This issue does not happen on slow machines, or configurations that take a long time to shut down. For our case, it happens every time.

I am considering adding a "sleep N" in our bin/jira-service shutdown wrapper to avoid the problem.
fields.summary: Stand-alone JIRA shut down script does not wait until JIRA and container exit before continuing increases odds of unclean shut down

Steps needed to replicate the problem:
# create a test message in Outlook that consists an image significant in size e.g. 1280 x 1024,
!TestImage.jpg|thumbnail!
# copy the image to clipboard,
# in JIRA navigate to a test issue > 'Attach screenshot' and paste the image.
The image gets cropped as per below example
!AttachedTestImage.jpg|thumbnail!

If the original image is 'Pasted Special' to MS Word as any of the support image formats, the image gets cropped too. However, if the image is just 'Pasted' or pasted as HTML Content the image retains its original size.
fields.summary: Images pasted from Outlook 2007 get cropped

fields.description:
We'd like to create a REST API for JIRA.

The main aim is to make it simpler for administrators and developers to retrieve issue and project information from JIRA, and update issue and project information on JIRA.

Please add comments to this issue, letting us know the functionality you would find useful in a JIRA REST API.

*Background information:*
* Introduction to REST APIs: If you would like to know more about REST in general, try the RESTwiki's guide to REST In Plain English:
http://rest.blueoxen.net/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?RestInPlainEnglish
* Developing your own REST APIs for JIRA: Developers can add their own REST APIs to JIRA by creating a JIRA plugin that includes the REST plugin module:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/REST+Plugin+Module+Type
* Understanding the principles behind Atlassian REST API design: You may be interested in the guidelines followed by the Atlassian developers who are designing REST APIs for Atlassian applications:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Guidelines+for+Atlassian+REST+API+Design
fields.summary: REST API for JIRA

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to migrate a custom fields made in jira 3.13 to jira 4.0 but I have a problem with its custom field searcher.

I use the following code in atlassian-plugin.xml (this code comes from system-customfieldtypes-plugin.xml which is part of jira source code)

{code:xml}
    <customfield-searcher key="exactnumber2" name="Number Searcher"
        i18n-name-key="admin.customfield.searcher.exactnumber.name"
        class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.ExactNumberSearcher">
        <description key="admin.customfield.searcher.exactnumber.desc">Allow searching for a number which exactly matches.</description>

        <resource type="velocity" name="search" location="templates/plugins/fields/edit-searcher/search-basictext.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="templates/plugins/fields/view-searcher/view-searcher-basictext.vm"/>
        <valid-customfield-type package="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes" key="float"/>
        <valid-customfield-type package="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes" key="importid"/>

        <valid-customfield-type package="org.hakanai.jira.plugins.order.core" key="ordertype"/>

    </customfield-searcher>   
{code}

However I always have the following error :

{quote}
2009-11-20 20:33:19,767 http-8080-Processor24 ERROR hugo 73999x18x1 1qu0oyr http://localhost:8080/secure/admin/CreateCustomField.jspa [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] Exception when retrieving plugin module exactnumber, will disable plugin org.hakanai.jira.plugins.jira-order-plugin
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.ExactNumberSearcher': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 0 of type [com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager]: : No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager]: expected at least 1 matching bean; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager] is defined: Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager]: expected at least 1 matching bean
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:152)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ResettableLazyReference.get(ResettableLazyReference.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraResourcedModuleDescriptor.getModule(JiraResourcedModuleDescriptor.java:124)

{quote}


it seems to be related with  JRA-18431 , JRA-18008,  GHS-1394 but according to JRA-18431 it should be fixed now. 
In jira source code ExactNumberSearcher is using an interface and not a concrete implementation. 
So I don't understand, is FieldVisibilityManager available for OSGI plugins (v2 plugins) ?
fields.summary: No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.web.FieldVisibilityManager] when instantiating ExactNumberSearcher

fields.description:
I have a filter which I put into the Two Dimensional Stats Portlet and set the X axis to be Assignee and Y axis to be Priority. However when I click on the numbered links the issue navigator does not show the correct number of issues. It seems like whatever is on the Y axis, that will be filtered in the Issue Navigator but the X axis value will be ignored. I was able to verify this by switching the axises for Assignee and Priority, if Assignee becomes Y and Priority becomes X, the issue navigator will filter on assignee and not priority.

Is this a known issue?

Would it be possible to create a report plugin with the same logic as the portlet, and an Excel view?

fields.description:
The versions of various 3rd-party JARs such as javamail, bouncycastle, log4j and so forth that are bundled with the application are seriously lagging.  This causes issues while trying to use modern features of those JARs.

While the 3.x branch is declining, and 4.x has made the update to modern versions of 3rd-party JARs, it would be extremely helpful to back-port those 3rd-party JAR updates.

The lack of this prevents us from moving forward with some plugin functionality that is required.  While we could, of course, over-write the JARs ourselves, that seems to be a very sub-optimal solution.  Especially given the age of the bundled JARs.
fields.summary: Update bundled 3rd party JARs: javamail, bouncycastle, log4j, etc
Allow updates from JQL

fields.description:
Random selenium test failures are being caused by the auiplugin failing to load after 60 seconds. However, this timeout is always preceded by:
{code}WARN admin 58476x2493x1 opcmfn /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Ignoring the Spring context that was just created for plugin com.atlassian.auiplugin.  
The plugin is in an invalid state, INSTALLED, that doesn't support a transition to enabled.  Most likely, it was disabled due to a timeout.{code}

i.e. the warning about the plugin's invalid state happens *before* the plugin is disabled

This seems to sometimes happen with the oauth service provider plugin as well.

Other points of interest:
 * the auiplugin eventually gets re-enabled in subsequent tests for the run, e.g. test 1 fails because of this, but test 2 will pass and the auiplugin looks to be enabled successfully
 * this seems to have happened after plugins were upgraded from 2.4.0.beta5 to 2.4.0.rc4 

See:
 * https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/SEL-ENTFFOX35BATCH09-41/artifact/Cargo-Logs/TEST-com.atlassian.jira.webtest.selenium.harness.SeleniumTestHarness.txt (line 21199, 21452) for an example of auiplugin failures
 * https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/SEL-ENTFFOX35BATCH09-41/
 * https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/SEL-ENTFFOX2-1558/artifact/Cargo-Logs/TEST-com.atlassian.jira.webtest.selenium.harness.SeleniumTestHarness.txt (line 168745,168998 warning, 67 mb file) for an example of oauth service provider plugin failures. Other auiplugin failures also present in this file
fields.summary: Invalid plugin state causes plugin loading to timeout

fields.description:
The import wizard limits the creation of custom fields to 5 types (select, multi select, date, user, text)
If the import data has fields  larger than 255 chars, which should go into custom fields , you end up with faults.
(The workaround is to create the custom fields beforehand)

It would be an improvement if more types are supported.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to be able to import large chunks of text into custom fields
Add more getIssueCount* remote api methods

fields.description:
Sometimes we create an account that is rarely use. After a while the owner of the account has forgotten that he has one (account) and asked to have an account created. We check for double but when it come to created users, JIRA is not the easiest software to check for double. 
The possibility to merge account would facilitate the work of the admin.
fields.summary: New feature that would allow the administrator to merge accounts that were created more than once

fields.description:
When I add a filter that I have already defined to the dashboard, the columns appear in alphabetically order, not the order I defined them in the filter. This is not very useful because I can't see key fields without opening the issue. 
The gadget does allow you (independently from the saved filters configuration) to specify the columns that you will see and this is persisted as part of the gadget configuration. However, it does not allow you to specify the order.
I did raise a support issue and was told to raise a feature request.
fields.summary: Dashboard filter column order does not display correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19766].
{panel}
Hi,

Jira users in my company report that the Project Summary page does not show all charts they would like to see. I have suggested that they could create a dashboard containing all relevant charts, but they complain that they cannot name the gadgets as they would like.

For example the chart which is presented as 'Issues: 30 Day Summary' at the Project Summary page, could be placed at the dashboard, but its name is set to 'Created vs Resolved Chart: <Project Name>'. That would be great if users could edit the title.

Thank you,
 Lukasz
fields.summary: Editing gadget titles
